vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
Βηθσαιδά (Rec. -σαϊδά), and -δάν (Mt, Mk, ll. with), ἡ, indecl. (Syr., house of fish),
Bethsaida, a town on NE. shore of the Sea of Galilee: Luk.9:10. It is generally supposed that a second B. on the W. shore is referred to in Mat.11:21, Mrk.6:45 8:22, Luk.10:13, Jhn.1:45 12:21 (DB, i, 282f.; but see Swete on Mrk.6:45).
__2. 2. Βηθζαθά, ἡ, indecl. (perh. Aram. בֵּית זַיְתָה, house of olives) Jhn.5:2..†
(From Abbott-Smith. LSJ has no entry)
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
§ Bethsaida, "site [house] of fishing"
also spelled Βηθσαιδάν (1035) Bethsaida, indeclinable (1) A city of Galilee, Mt. 11:21; Mk. 6:45. (2) A city of Lower Gaulanitis, near the Lake of Gennesareth, Lk. 9:10
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
伯賽大 这个專有名詞 地名在亞蘭文的意思是 "魚之家"
革尼撒勒湖以北, 約但河以東, 靠近入湖口之處
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
伯赛大 这个专有名词 地名在亚兰文的意思是 "鱼之家"
革尼撒勒湖以北, 约但河以东, 靠近入湖口之处
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: Bêthsaiđa / Bết-sai-đa « Nhà của săn bắn hoặc đánh cá » Xem H1004-H6719
